evidence.pdf_reference: Ni(OH) 2 was used as a lowcost cocatalyst.It was observed that the HC-C 3 N 4 Ni(OH) 2 sample has the highest hydrocarbon product formation rate (1.48 molh -1 g -1 of CH 4 generation and 0.73 molh -1 g -1 of CH 3 OH generation).This can be ascribed to efficient interfacial electron mobility starting HC-C 3 N 4 to Ni(OH) 2 nanoparticles and thus prevents rearrangement of photoexcited electron-hole pairs.This led to effective charge dissolution and as a result improved the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction

the reactor before sealing), and 0.25 mL 4 M HCl solution (introduced into the reactor by a syringe) apart from this no catalyst washing or fresh introduction was performed.Clearly from our results, the methanol and methane production activity remains unchanged for the first and the second runs, and it slightly decreased in the successive run.The above result indicates that the as-prepared HC-C 3 N 4 Ni(OH) 2 , sample exhibits admirable stability during the photocatalytic CO 2 reduction activity.Besides,

to reactants, alongside lesser recombination rate due to rapid charge carrier transportability (Liu et al. 2010).Based on this, under visible light irradiation, the HC-C 3 N 4 sample has a more excellent electronic band structure and the photocatalytic reductive ability for reactants than the bulk C 3 N 4 .Upon loading Ni(OH) 2 cocatalyst through the intimate contact between HC-C 3 N 4 and Ni(OH) 2 , achieve improved visible light CO 2 reduction, the photoexcited electrons would effectively migrate from

would effectively migrate from the HC-C 3 N 4 to the Ni(OH) 2 , to produce CH 4 and CH 3 OH via photocatalytic reaction, where Ni(OH) 2 acts as an electron receiver which significantly enhanced CO 2 reduction activity over the composited HC-C 3 N 4 Ni(OH) 2 photocatalyst.
